keyFactors.title: Ravens Win Streak
keyFactors.description: Baltimore on 5-game winning streak, playing with confidence

keyFactors.title: Prime Time Home
keyFactors.description: Ravens dominant at home in prime time spots

keyFactors.title: Bengals Missing Higgins
keyFactors.description: Tee Higgins out - reduces Cincinnati's offensive firepower

keyFactors.title: Division Dominance
keyFactors.description: Ravens have owned this matchup recently

quarterBreakdown.description: Derrick Henry TD run gave Ravens early lead
Turnovers started piling up for Baltimore

gameResults.whenMissed: Ravens never close to covering - lost outright by 18

whatWentWrong.title: Turnover Disaster
whatWentWrong.description: Ravens committed 5 turnovers - impossible to cover giving the ball away that much

whatWentWrong.title: Lamar Struggled
whatWentWrong.description: Jackson had 2 INTs and a fumble - rare terrible game

whatWentWrong.title: Burrow Back
whatWentWrong.description: Joe Burrow returned healthy and played excellent

whatWentWrong.title: Divisional Variance
whatWentWrong.description: AFC North games are always unpredictable

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No - this was a complete disaster. 5 turnovers is an outlier event. Ravens had been rolling but fell apart completely.

closingLineValue.verdict: Negative CLV - line moved against us

keyTakeaways: Joe Burrow returning healthy changed everything
verdict: Disaster. Ravens committed 5 turnovers and lost 32-14 at home. Bengals dominated. Catalyst factors were irrelevant given turnover implosion.
